Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements

Class ElementFactory

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.ElementFactory
public class ElementFactory
extends java.lang.Object
An implementation of the Factory design pattern for creating Elements for Page objects.
Author:
dougnoel@gmail.com

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • createElement

      public static java.lang.Object createElement​(java.lang.String elementName, Page page)
      Returns an Object that is an Element using the element name and Page. We look first in the Sentinel jar, then in the local repository class files. If we don't find the element type in either location, we create a base Element type.
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the name of the element to create
      page - Page the page object that contains the element definition
      Returns:
      Object the element that is created

    • retrieveClassBySimpleName

      private static java.lang.Class<?> retrieveClassBySimpleName​(java.lang.String elementType)
      Returns Class <?> corresponding to the passed elementType if it exists in the com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements package. If there is no class in the com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements package that matches the elementType, this method returns null.
      Parameters:
      elementType - String the elementType from the page object that is spelled the same (case-insensitive) as the class of the element
      Returns:
      Class <?> the Class corresponding to the passsed elementType. null if not found.

    • findElementData

      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> findElementData​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String pageName)
      Returns a Map <String, String> which contains all data for an element that is declared in the page object YAML file for the given page.
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the name of the element
      pageName - String the name of the page
      Returns:
      Map <String, String> the collection of keys and values which were declared in the page object YAML file for the given element on the given page.
